review: I have been on this medication for 2 weeks now and hoping side effects subside. I'm 47yrs old with a Ventricula Septal Defect and It has worked as in lowering my BP but I am struggling in Taekwondo training and have had to sit out due to dizziness and racing heartbeat then swollen feet then I sleep afterwards. This med was added to Lostartan and Felodipine out of desperation to lower BP as other meds didn't suit but this one is probably the worse for side effects so far.
Dreadful. Cannot walk far due to pain in legs. Bleeding nose, sleeplessness. Water infections. Should be banned.
Causing UTI, nose bleeds, sleeplessness and stuffy nose

An awful drug. Caused me severe anxiety and it makes you heart go like the clappers even on a low dose! Other side effects I experienced were shortness of breath and a fluttering heart beat. It's time this dangerous drug was taken off the market.

Started taking 2mg doxazosin about a year ago the Doctor kept doubling my dose cos it was not working ,now I take 16mg a day 8mg in morning and 8mg in the evening feel dizzy regular and sex drive gone don`t mind that but blood pressure is still sky high 187/117 seems to me that it does not work going back to my GP to ask him to put me on something else.
I’ve tried many blood pressure meds all too strong but 1mg of Doxazosin is keeping it under control  I’m a female weighing 55kgs

I'm on 4mg of Doxazosin since February and have gained 15 lbs weight and tinnitus! So fed up! I'm also on a diuretic Indapamide 1.5 too. I have hypothyroidism too on 50 mg of eltroxin. Showing signs of systemic lupus in antibodies, but waiting on appointment. I think my BP meds are causing weight gain and tinnitus. Has it affected anybody here?Desperate
On doxazosin I had 1 early episode of dizziness but ok now. Lisinapril gave me a bad cough as did Losarten.

I had been taking tamsulosin for BPH and when my blood pressure got too high, I switched to doxazosin. I have reacted very very badly to a beta blocker in the past but have had no trouble with alpha blockers. The dose is up to 4 mg. twice a day and I have no obvious side effects. My BP is still a little higher than my doctor likes but lower than it was, and the BPH remains under control.

Intolerable side effects from doxazosin of weakness, depression (on antidepressants but this drug has worsened my condition). Blurred vision, headaches, right side stomach pain ,insomnia. I am 86yrs of age and my life is miserable on this drug.

Have had high blood pressure for a number of years, now 68 been on labetalol 200mg 2x day and enalapril 10 mg 2x day, have high epinephrine, metanephrine, endo doc switched med to doxazosin 4mg at night.  I have taken it for only 2 days pulse went up 120 and blood pressure went up, not down.  I'm still on enalapril dose, feel dizzy sick to stomach and headache mostly in the back of head, doc talks about raising doxazosin to 8mg no way, am 155 lbs 5'9'

Started with 4mg doxazosin + 2mg bendroflumethiazide.BP not under control.  Over the years the dosage of doxazosin was increased to 2x4mg in the morning taken with 1 Bendro and then another 4mg of Dox at night. I don't feel dizzy but have shortness of breath, sometimes think I forget to breathe (?), feeling of anxiousness in my chest, which eases off a little with deep breaths. Out and about during the day I feel fine. The shortness of breathe/ anxiety is noticeable when resting.
Was on 4 mg  doxazosin per day which was making me tired and dizzy, have now reduced it to 2 mg and feel a lot better.But it has an effect on my peeing which is a reduced rate now.BP seems ok

My husband was prescribed 4 mg Doxazosin to hopefully reduce the number of trips to the bathroom as well as lowering the blood pressure. It was prescribed in place of the HCTZ that was lowering the Creatinine levels and it was to be taken along with the Metoprolol he had been taking for 2 years. The side effects listed for Doxazosin in the info given by the pharmacy were very generic and no specific warnings were listed on the bottle other than possible impairments while driving. No specific instructions were given by the doctor or pharmacist and it said "take one a day" on the bottle.He was a healthy 150 lbs. 78 year old swimming a mile three days a week at the local gym. On the day he started taking Doxazosin he had a fainting or  nearly fainting spell within 45 minutes that resulted in a deadly ground level fall fracturing the skull and closed brain injuries. He died hours later. Please be careful and avoid taking this medication.

I have been on doxazosin for over a year now, along with a few other prescriptions for my high blood pressure and kidneys.  The doctor prescribed 4 mg twice a day.  It works pretty well at reducing my blood pressure, but has some terrible side effects.  I completely lost my drive for sex, which is usually very strong. In addition, it caused retrograde ejaculation (no semen on orgasm). I found that unacceptable, so I reduced  my dosage to 4mg on Monday, Wednesday and Friday.  My blood pressure has gotten worse, but my libido and ejaculation has returned to normal.  Got to go back and see doctor, try to find a new medication, but I am running out of options.  I hate this drug.
Doxazosin allergic reaction after medication strength was doubled, it was a terrible experience with hives

Have been prescribed 1mg daily now on it for four days. Having some dizziness but not too bad.  This only started yesterday and does wear off.  Anyone help with how long this is likely to last before it settles?

I am on 2mg of Doxasozin and it seems to reduce my blood pressure. Side effects are horrendous though. Exhaustion like you have the flu or are approaching end of life. When I first started on them I couldn't even walk from my car to my office without feeling like I was about to collapse and breathless. I know for sure it is them as I have come off them myself several times and I am back to normal.

Started on 1mg dose after being prescribed 2mg. I have trust issues with any med, blood pressure ok . Been taking it a month. Eyes are red and swollen, sex drive is about half what it was, having trouble getting erection, I sleep better but not worth the other side effects. Weight gain also. No more for me! I'm not happy.

I had radio therapy for testicular cancer in 1977 - aged 30. A camera revealed scarring to my bladder neck in about 2005, and telangectasia (spelling may be wrong). Doxazosin initially prescribed for persistent high blood pressure reasons at 2 mg, but recently raised to 4 then 8 mg per day. Higher doses maybe cause a pounding heart for 1 to 3 hours after waking - not nice. Also a dry mouth and nasal congestion. But urine flow much better when taking the drug. I should also mention that I have various allergies.

Switched from a non-selective beta blocker for treatment of Complex Post Traumatic Stress Disorder due to infant adoption. Doctor started me at 4mg, but I blacked out upon getting out of bed three days later. I had the prescription lowered to 1mg, but am taking half now and it is highly effective with virtually no side effects for me. No more PTSD-related nightmares due to the longer half-life, and very little hypervigilance. I am also able to be more physically active now than with a beta blocker, which is great.

I have had good results using Cardura, but when using a generic, I had problems with dizziness, eyes seemed to be crossed, weakness.  The pill lists lactose as an "inert" ingredient.  I have had milk allergies since I was a teenager . Since I cut the 1 mg tab of the very small Cardura in half I was not getting much lactose and it worked fine.  With the generic at least 10 times larger, I was getting much more of the lactose to which I was allergic, so I was having severe side effects. This is the first time I have found the list of inert ingredients.  I was allergic to many medicines before this and the addition of lactose may have been the reason.
I was taking 1 MG with breakfast and found on occasion I had dizziness. I cut the pill in half and no longer experience dizziness.
Taken to lower blood pressure and to increase urine flow at night.  Worked great for both.

doctor started me on 4mg straight away which caused bad side effects.  instructions say start at 1mg so i am trying that.  also wasnt told by doctor to take at night so i will see if that helps. so far not happy anyone else had problems?  i thought i'd pass out in town centre not good.

It works better than any other blood pressure medicine I have taken and I have taken many including 3 more that I take beside the doxazosin. I take the doxazosin at night or break it in half and take it in the afternoon if my pressure is running high. It dose not work at all for me regarding prostate issues.

Cardura (doxazosin):Took 1 8mg Cardura daily.  Experienced dizziness and nausea for the first 3 days but later adjusted to the medication and  maintained pressure around 120/80.  On doctor's advise, Cardura discontinued and replaced with alternative medication due to  excessively fast pulse/heart rate up to 100/s after 6 months on Cardura
